articles.title: Theory-driven Analysis for Ecological Data
articles.contents:
The objective of this five-day workshop, co-organized by the
FRB-CESAB
and the
GdR TheoMoDive
is to train young researchers in theory-based approaches to model ecological data
(e.g. temporal series, macroecology, interaction and trophic network, etc.).
The second edition of this training course will take place from the 3rd to the
7th of April 2023 in the CESAB premises in Montpellier.

Program
General schedule:
08:30-10:45 - Courses10:45-11:00 - Coffee break11:00-12:30 - Courses12h30-14:00 - Lunch14:00-15:45 - Practices15:45-16:00 - Coffee break16:00-17:30 - Practices17:30-18:00 - Break18:00-19:00 - Guest speaker

Day 1
Speaker: Isabelle Gounand, Sonia Kéfi, and Claire Jacquet
      
Icebreaker and introduction of the week
      
Introduction to modelling and theory
      
Guest speaker: Kim Cuddington (Waterloo Univ., Canada)

Day 2
Speakers: Emanuel Fronhofer, Jhelam Deshpande
      
Temporal series and dynamics in ecology
      
Guest speaker: Frédéric Barraquand (CNRS, Bordeaux)

Day 3
Speakers: Vincent Calcagno, Maxime Dubart
      
Spatial data, macro-ecology and co-occurrences
      
Guest speaker: Virginie Ravigné (CIRAD, Montpellier)

Day 4
Speakers: François Massol, Claire Jacquet, Matthieu Barbier
      
Interaction networks, trophic networks, and complexity in ecology
      
Guest speaker: Sonia Kéfi (CNRS, Montpellier)

Day 5
      
Subgroups projects

Prerequisites
Please follow this tutorial to correctly install your
working environment (R, RStudio, R packages, etc.).

articles.title: Installation of R & RStudio
articles.contents:

Installation

For the workshop
Corrections
Reuse
Citation


 
Please install the latest versions of 
and RStudio.

Installation
  Windows
Download  at:https://cran.r-project.org/
        
Click on Download R for Windows
        
Click on base
        
Click on Download R 4.2.3 for Windows
        
Open R-4.2.3-win.exe and follow instructions

Download RStudio Desktop at:https://posit.co/download/rstudio-desktop/
        
Download the version for Windows 10/11 (the .exe and not the .zip)
        
Open RStudio-2023.03.0-386.exe and follow instructions
        
Check if RStudio has found .
Launch RStudio and run:


R.version.string
## [1] "R version 4.2.3 (2023-03-15) -- "Shortstop Beagle"



Download Rtools4.2 at:https://cran.r-project.org/bin/windows/Rtools/rtools42/rtools.html
        
Download the 64-bit version for Windows
        
Open rtools42-5355-5357.exe and follow instructions
The installation of Rtools4.2 is strongly recommended to install some packages
from sources.
Rtools4.2 contains in particular the utility make.
Restart RStudio and check that  finds the utility make:


Sys.which("make")
## "C:\\rtools42\\usr\\bin\\make.exe"


Now you can install packages from sources:


install.packages("jsonlite", type = "source")



  macOS
Th easiest way to set up your environment is by using the package manager for macOS
Homebrew. With this tool you can install (and update) your
software directly from the terminal. First you need to install the Apple software
Command Line Tools for Xcode.
Open a terminal,
run this line and accept the license:
## Install Xcode Command Line Tools ----
sudo xcode-select --install
Then you can install Homebrew:
## Install Homebrew ----
/bin/bash -c "$(curl -fsSL https://raw.githubusercontent.com/Homebrew/install/HEAD/install.sh)"

## Check installation ----
brew --version
## Homebrew 4.0.9

## Update repositories (list of available software) ----
brew update
Follow these lines to install your environment:
## Install utilities for R ----
brew install --cask xquartz     ## Graphical window system
brew install gfortran           ## FORTRAN compiler for GCC

## Install R ----
brew install --cask r

## Install RStudio Desktop ----
brew install --cask rstudio
Open RStudio and check your installation:


R.version.string
## "R version 4.2.3 (2023-03-15) -- "Shortstop Beagle"

Sys.which("make")
##            make 
## "/usr/bin/make"



To keep your system up-to-date, run regularly:
## Update environment ----
brew update && brew upgrade --greedy

 Ubuntu
First check your version of Ubuntu in a terminal:
## Check Ubuntu version ----
cat /etc/issue
## Ubuntu 22.04 LTS

Table 1. List of CRAN repositories for different versions of Ubuntu

Install  by following these steps
(change the URL below by the one specific to your version of Ubuntu, cf. Table 1) :
## Install APT utilities ----
sudo apt install wget software-properties-common

## Add CRAN GPG key ----
wget -qO- https://cloud.r-project.org/bin/linux/ubuntu/marutter_pubkey.asc | sudo tee -a /etc/apt/trusted.gpg.d/cran_ubuntu_key.asc

## Add CRAN repository to APT repositories list ----
sudo add-apt-repository 'deb https://cloud.r-project.org/bin/linux/ubuntu jammy-cran40/'

## Update packages list ----
sudo apt update

## Install R ----
sudo apt install r-base

## Install R (for development, recommended) ----
sudo apt install build-essential
sudo apt install r-base-dev

To install RStudio Desktop visit this page:
https://posit.co/download/rstudio-desktop/, download the
.deb file for Ubuntu 22 (Ubuntu 18+/Debian 10+ depending on your version)
and install it.
Alternatively, you can install RStudio Desktop from the terminal:
## Install wget utility ----
sudo apt install wget

## Download RStudio Desktop installer (Ubuntu = 22.04) ----
wget https://download1.rstudio.org/electron/jammy/amd64/rstudio-2023.03.0-386-amd64.deb

## Download RStudio Desktop installer (Ubuntu < 22.04) ----
# wget https://download1.rstudio.org/electron/jammy/amd64/rstudio-2023.03.0-386-amd64.deb

## Install RStudio Desktop ----
sudo dpkg -i rstudio-2023.03.0-386-amd64.deb
# sudo dpkg -i rstudio-2023.03.0-386-amd64.deb

## Remove installer ----
rm rstudio-2023.03.0-386-amd64.deb
# rm rstudio-2023.03.0-386-amd64.deb

Open RStudio and check your installation:


R.version.string
## 4.2.3 (2023-03-15) -- "Shortstop Beagle"

Sys.which("make")
##            make 
## "/usr/bin/make"



To keep your system up-to-date, do not forget to frequently run:
## Update system ----
sudo apt update && sudo apt upgrade -y

For the workshop
You will need to install the rstan package:


## CRAN package ----
install.packages("rstan")

## Check the installation ----
example(stan_model, package = "rstan", run.dontrun = TRUE)


If the example model fails, please read this page.
